Title: Destroy the enemy's artillery: the expert revealed the secret of the success of the Defense Forces o...
Description: Military expert Petro Chernyk told ArmyInform why this was achieved and how much enemy artillery still needs to be destroyed in order to deprive Russia of the possibility of using these weapons against Ukraine. It is no secret that in order to suppress and destroy the artillery of the Russian occupiers, the Ukrainian defenders are conducting a counter-battery fight on different areas of the front. — First of all, there are a few very important questions about the artillery that need to be cleared up. Despite the fact that drones enter the great war as a very serious striking force, no one will ever replace artillery on the battlefield. Why? Of course, the drone is very good, it is a high-precision and high-quality weapon. But the drone can carry 2, 3, well, a maximum of 5 kg of explosives. Instead, 152-mm or 155-mm artillery ammunition is within 50 kg of the iron itself plus 5-7 kg of explosives, Petro Chernyk emphasizes. Another key point. Ammunition shrapnel is the primary impact force. After all, artillery ammunition can scatter them at great speed over large areas, that is, it is a much more powerful and serious striking force than a drone. Artillery therefore remains paramount in this war. At the moment, despite the use of even drones, at least 80% of the war takes place with the help of artillery. So far, the Defense Forces have set absolute records for the destruction of enemy artillery. More than 18,000 Russian artillery units were affected. That's a fantastic amount. At the beginning of this war, especially until the spring of 2023, 90% of the hits in counter-battery duels were actually done by artillery. That is, cannon on cannon. Why did we manage to work so well? Ukrainian gunners have modern means for accurate detection of enemy artillery. These are, in particular, counter-battery radars, which were provided by our partner countries as part of military assistance to counter Russian aggression. The German COBRA radar system is very effective in detecting enemy artillery. It is considered one of the world's best ground-based weapon detection systems. With a declared detection range of up to 100 km, COBRA is capable of detecting and classifying up to 40 units of artillery systems in two minutes. Plus, the American counter-battery system AN/TPQ-36 at a distance of up to 24 km can count up to 20 units of artillery barrels. And at close distances of 4-5 km, the AN/TPQ-48 and 50 systems are already operating. To defeat enemy armored vehicles, our artillery actively and extremely effectively uses -smart munitions- such as SMArt 155 and BONUS, which contain homing subelements. Let's not forget the M982 Excalibur guided munitions. In the spring of 2023, the mass use of FPV drones began. Precisely for the destruction of enemy artillery installations. — Our gunners have learned to calculate the location of the enemy's artillery installations very well. By the way, again thanks to these counter-battery systems. They were able to accurately direct FPV drones. Therefore, we have a phenomenal result for the summer of this year. More than 4,500 artillery installations of the Rosarmy were affected. If you divide this indicator by the number 72 (for example, the regular artillery brigade of the enemy is 72 artillery units. - Ed.), then more than 60 enemy artillery brigades were destroyed (damaged). But there are several nuances. Because quite understandable questions arise, why does Russia have such huge reserves in terms of artillery supply? And what is their margin of safety? At the beginning of the invasion, the regular complex of the Russian Federation had approximately 5,400 barrels and more than 10,000 in storage. Plus up to 5 thousand mortars. Currently, according to the General Staff of the Armed Forces, more than 18,000 enemy artillery systems have been destroyed. But there is a certain pitfall, I would say, in terms of calculation. It's not a bug, it's just that accounting is very complicated. — Let's take a look at the D-20 installation as an example. It is a heavy gun, has a large armor plate, and is on rubber wheels. A drone flies into it with a 2-3 kilogram explosive. A cannon is considered hit even if the wheels are burned and the sight is broken. But often after the explosion, the barrel, breech and recoil remain intact. How to count then? Is it already a decommissioned barrel or not? No, not written off, explains Petro Chernyk. Losses are not 100% destruction of artillery systems. In most cases, these are damages that only put the unit out of combat condition for a while, while keeping it repairable. - Then the Russians took the cannon to the factory, repaired it and returned it to the battle. That is, it is necessary to take into account the reverse cycle of equipment repair. It is simply impossible to calculate how many art barrels actually survived the repair. Therefore, in my opinion, 18 thousand destroyed artillery systems of the Russian Federation is not their absolute destruction. To be fair, it's an injury. It is a completely different thing when an Excalibur munition flies precisely on enemy equipment, and nothing is left of the installation. Then, of course, we can talk about the absolute destruction of technology. — Here lies the philosophy of answering the question, what is the enemy's margin of safety. And it is extremely difficult to give an exact answer, how much more needs to be hit, plus 6 or 7 thousand artillery installations, in order to completely deprive Russia of the possibility of using artillery on the battlefield, the military expert claims. It should not be forgotten that the Soviet Union produced a huge number of samples of a wide variety of artillery and delivered them, in particular, to so-called friendly countries. Russia is conducting targeted work to return artillery systems from African countries to ensure its own needs in the war against Ukraine. The Chinese are very covertly, in small numbers, but also provide the Russians with these weapons. Plus help to the Russian Federation from North Korea.

Title: Three days in a coma, -Smerch- and pure victory in Japanese: the story of teacher - warrior Anton
Description: The first story is about military serviceman Anton, a former educator and physical education teacher of the Novomykolaiv educational and rehabilitation center. What is it like to live without one kidney after being injured on the Bakhmut direction? Why did Anton's father not recognize his son's voice in September 2022? A military man told ArmyInform about this: - Before serving in the Armed Forces, I worked in an educational institution for children with severe speech disabilities. Work there was very difficult and troublesome. The groups of children were small, 12–16 students, because in such a school you have to pay more attention to everyone. He was a physical education teacher there, but most of the time he worked as an educator… Two educators were assigned to each class, who, in fact, performed the function of parents. For example, my shift starts. I take the children to the dining room. After that, they change clothes and the self-training begins. And you work with the children until the evening. Then you put them to sleep. One word, like a hen with chicks. And you come in the morning, wake up the children, dress them for lessons, and everyone should be clean and washed. You take them to breakfast, then take them to class and sit them at their desks, check for workbooks, textbooks. Morally, it is difficult… At that time, I was young, I still had enough strength. But if now, I probably wouldn't have the strength for such a job. Because, really, hard work. But then it's nice when your former, already adult students see you on the street, come up to say hello, and you understand that you worked for nothing. In 2017, I started serving in the 93rd separate mechanized brigade -Kholodny Yar-. I consider it my military alma mater. It was there that I gained combat experience. A large-scale invasion was encountered in this brigade. And on September 22, 2022, I was seriously injured in the direction of Bakhmut. There was an arrival. RSZV -Smerch-. Cartridge ammunition. It broke very close to me. Immediately such pain was not felt. And then… As a result of the injury, the right kidney is absent. They collected me, as they say, piece by piece. I have prostheses and implants inside. In total, I had 10 operations in a month and a half. …In the hospital in Dnipro, the doctors put me in a coma for three days. When I woke up after that, I did not understand anything. He calmed down only when he saw his own sister in the ward. Another interesting moment before the hospital was when he was still at the headquarters. He opened his eyes. I asked the doctor for his phone number, dialed his father, because of all the numbers at that moment, he was the only one I remembered. And when you are under anesthesia, your voice changes for a certain period. I say: -It's me, your son Anton.- And the father: -This is not my son.- Because the number is not mine. And at that moment I say his favorite phrase, -wasari awaset ippon-. This is a judo term that translates to clear victory. Only then did my father recognize me. He asks what happened. I answer that it hurt a little, but everything is fine. All in all, I'm very lucky to be alive. But for something I stayed here in this world. …In July 2023, I was already in the army. Of course, he could not return to the brigade with such a diagnosis. Therefore, at first he served for a short period in one of the RTCC. Currently, I am in another structure of the Ground Forces Command. Some of the students who studied at the educational and rehabilitation center where I taught also joined the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. And even two have already died. …By the way, I support the fact that the concept of the school subject -Defense of Ukraine- is changing now. I consider it very appropriate. And it had to be done since 2014. Children must be taught so that they are ready. Moreover, we do not know what will happen tomorrow. It is necessary for children to be able to protect themselves, their family, their relatives.

Title: 50 kg of happiness on the enemy's head: a heavy-duty drone with a significant flight range was prese...
Description: Warsaw defense publication Defence24 notes that, first of all, the new concept of the Polish unmanned aerial vehicle Warmate 50 attracts attention with its size, ArmiyaInform reports. In addition to the general presentation of the concept of their new creation, the Polish aircraft builders have currently limited themselves … general data about this UAV. It became known that, compared to the previous products of the company, it has much larger dimensions and, as the name suggests, a warhead weighing 50 kg. This development is distinguished not only by its large dimensions, but also by its functionality, since in this case it is the first sample of a long-range kamikaze drone created in Poland. At the moment, it is assumed that the Warmate 50 will be able to hit targets at a distance of several hundred kilometers. As follows from the publication of the IKK Defense Express defense portal, its experts believe that the Polish long-range drone kamikaze is just taking its final shape. Because, for example, regarding the power plant, there is only general information that it will be an -internal combustion engine-, the expected indicators regarding speed and specific flight range are not mentioned. There is also only a general mention that, unlike previous models, the Warmate 50 has been developed with an approach that involves -maximizing combat effectiveness through the flexibility of surveillance functions-, so it will be an unmanned aerial vehicle -intended exclusively for strike missions-. -In other words, in the case of the Warmate 50, it is assumed that this kamikaze drone will hit stationary targets at a long distance according to predetermined coordinates, and the in-flight guidance function at the command of the operator will not be available,- DE experts said. It is emphasized that the basis for the development of Warmate 50 was the Warmate 20 kamikaze drone, which is equipped with a warhead weighing 20 kilograms and the presentation of which took place in May 2024. In general, Warmate 50 is given the following characteristics - this drone will be able to fly even to Moscow. UAVs from the Warmate family are well known to drone operators from the Defense Forces of Ukraine. Within the charity project -Polskie drony Warmate do obrony Ukrainy!- Polish benefactors donated money for the purchase of dozens of drones. Our editors told in detail about these winged products from RP. The mention of -Moscow- caused a nervous reaction -from across the border-. In those swamps, the traditional great-power curling took place. In particular, some news outlets at one time compared the Warmate 50's predecessor, the Warmate 20, to the Russian Lancet. At the same time, the Kremlin troubadours shyly forgot to clarify that this ZALA -Lancet- , well somehow, VERY similar to … Israeli drone HERO. Warmate 20 in the Russian Federation was called -an analogue of that which has no analogues-, arguing that the warhead is larger than that of the Lancet and smaller than that of the Shahed/Gerany. In turn, editors from Warsaw's Polskie Radio noted: -Warmate 50 is an example of a solution that is increasingly dominating the modern battlefield. Thanks to a powerful warhead and a long flight range, the drone can significantly strengthen the operational capabilities of the Polish armed forces, especially in the context of delivering high-precision strikes on strategic targets.- Presentation of UAV Warmate 50. Video: NAFO Fella World Oleg Mashchenko

Title: Who did the propaganda win this time: fictional adventures of the Akhmatians in Kurshchyna
Description: This was noted by the Center for Strategic Communications and Information Security. In fact, this attack by a Kadyrov militant from the Akhmat unit is a development of the plot of Russian propaganda about the mass involvement of -mercenaries from NATO countries- in hostilities on the side of Ukraine. Russian fakers have been speculating on this since 2014. The plot about American mercenaries is needed by Kremlin propaganda to promote narratives about -foreign governance- in Ukraine and the desperate struggle against NATO aggression. Putin's propaganda invents -Western mercenaries- to explain the defeats of the Russians and the successes of the Ukrainians, whom it has ridiculed for decades. And Forward Observations Group, which Russian disinformers call a -private military company,- is a tactical equipment and medical equipment company founded by American veteran Derrick Bales. It has nothing to do with military operations in Ukraine. Creating such fakes allows the Kremlin to have support among the Russian population and to explain its own military failures. The successes of the Ukrainian army are often portrayed as the result of the help of -all-powerful- Western forces, rather than as achievements of the Ukrainian military. the Kremlin also constantly tries to portray Ukraine as a state that is not capable of standing up to Russia on its own and needs -mercenaries- for support. This is part of the narrative about the weakness of the Ukrainian army and the alleged -external management- of the country.
